Articles.Content:
I'm pretty pissed off you can't save during missions.

First they don't really explain how anything really works so you have to experiment with the items. Any way, so why can't save and go back if I choose when I am trying something?

No, instead I'm forced to refly every mission over and over till I get it right: even if it takes 20-30 minutes to get to the hard or questionable point of my flight. It sucks I can't save and try again from some mid point, but forced to re play from take off.
You can use F5 for quicksaving and F9 for quickloading. That should help a bit?

Before you start flaming, you'd better RTFM. 'Nuff said.

If you've done this, you'd know EXACTLY how parts work, meaning that you won't have to refly missions if you don't know how something works. For piloting errors, there is F5/F9, meaning that your arguments are invalid.

While the above points are valid, the game's tutorials need a heck of an update, and really all the controls should be covered by some kind of tutorial, however brief. So many controls go unnoticed for very long periods of time -- like Alt+L for stage lock, or Shift+F5/F9 for custom saves/loading custom saves.
